definitions: Calling on (a deity or spirit) in prayer, as a witness, or for inspiration.
Appealing to someone or something as an authority for an action or in support of an argument.
Calling forth a spirit or demon.
Calling into operation a law, a right, or a rule.
examples: The priest was invoking ancient blessings.
She was invoking her right to remain silent.
The lawyer was invoking a specific clause in the contract.
He was invoking the muse for inspiration.
